help.settings: See Settings > CAN in CMI menu

help.description: Receives and monitors all CoE (CAN over Ethernet) packets from all sources.
help.ideal: Ideal for debugging, logging and monitoring all CoE traffic.
help.filterNode: Optional: Filter packets from a specific CAN node (0 = all)
help.filterType: Filter by data type: All, Analog only or Digital only
help.includeRaw: Add complete raw data to msg.payload.raw

help.description: Receives values from a TA CMI via CoE (CAN over Ethernet).
help.nodeNumber: CAN node number (1-62, 0 = receive from any node - not recommended in production)
help.version: CoE version is set in the Config Node

help.description: Sends individual values to a TA CMI via CoE.
help.version: CoE version is set in the Config Node
help.debouncing: Values are buffered for 50ms to prevent overwriting
help.outputs: 2 outputs: [0] pass-through message, [1] debug info (hex, block state, units)

help.description: Sends a complete data block (4 values) to a TA CMI via CoE.
help.dataType: Analog (4 values) or Digital (4 bits from block 0 or 9)
help.blockMapping: Analog: 1-8 directly to CoE blocks 1-8. Digital: 1-4 → Block 0 (bits 0-15), 5-8 → Block 9 (bits 0-15)
help.inputs: 4 fixed inputs (Out 1-4 for Analog, Bit 1-4 for Digital)
help.debouncing: Values are buffered for 100ms to prevent overwriting
help.atomic: All 4 values are sent together as atomic update
